questions.question: Why do we use the scientific method?

choices.answer: to answer questions about the world around us
because my teacher said we had to
to get a good grade in science

questions.question: What is the first step of the scientific method?
What is a more "science-y" way to say educated guess?
How can you prove that your hypothesis is true or untrue?
Can a hypothesis be proved right or wrong?

choices.answer: Yes, there is always a right or wrong answer
No, there are no "right" or "wrong" answers in science

questions.question: Why is it important to test your hypothesis multiple times?

choices.answer: Because your teacher is a big meany and made you do it
because writing down lots of data makes you look real smart

questions.question: What is the best way to record the results of your experiment?

choices.answer: In a Data Table and Graphs
I don't need to record them, I have a good memory

questions.question: What is the first thing you should do if your results don't agree with your hypothesis?

choices.answer: Accept the fact that you failed at science
check any math calculations you did for errors

questions.question: If your results don't agree with your hypothesis, but your math is correct, what should you do?

choices.answer: change the numbers to make them work

questions.question: After checking math & re-doing experiment, results still don't agree with hypoth. -what next?

choices.answer: Draw conclusions and develop a new question and experiment
get an F on your lab report
fudge the answers and make it work

questions.question: What is the difference between results and conclusion?

choices.answer: results= data,  conclusions= how results relate to our world
Same thing, but conclusions written in complete sentences
its like comparing bananas and bananas
